_header: Sweet Jesu Christ to Thee / A guilty wretch I yield me
_description: A Prayer of Confession — in couplets

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
SWete Ihesu crist to þeA gulti wrecche Ich ȝelde
                    me…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…In to þat blisful Empyreþer þat þou
                    regnest lord and sire
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

CULDd82.First Lines: Swete Ihesu to theA gylty wrecche I yelde me…
CULDd82.Last Lines:
…to that kynges euerlestyng empireWhere he reigneth bothe
                    lorde and sire
CULDd82.Note:
17th-century transcript Cambridge UK,  Cambridge University Library Dd.14.26, ff.
                    42v-44.

BLAdd37787.First Lines:
Swete Ihesu cryste to theA gulti wreche I yelde
                    me…
BLAdd37787.Last Lines:
…In to þat blisful empyreTher as þou regnest lord
                    & syre

Baugh,  Nita Scudder.

BLHar210.First Lines:
SWete ihesu crist to þeA gulti wrecche y ȝulde
                    me…
BLHar210.Last Lines:
…In to þat blessede empireþer þou regnest lord
                    and sire

EDU114.First Lines:
…[ ] myn endyng day[ ] synne dey i maywith shrift &
                    hosel at…
EDU114.Last Lines:
…In to þat blys empereþer þu reynest lord &
                    sere
EDU114.Editions:
Borland,  Katherine R. 
             A Descriptive Catalogue of the Western Medieval Manuscripts in
                Edinburgh University Library
         Edinburgh: University Press, 1916: 334.

Lam559.Transcription:
…lord and sereAmongys the sayntis and aungelis brighteThe
                    whiche all be schinynge in thi lighteffor me alwaye to the
                    bysechyngeThat theder I may come at myn endingAmen
Lam559.Note: First three lines on this folio rubbed out.
Lam559.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild. 
             A Register of Middle English Religious & Didactic Verse.
         2 vols. London: Oxford University Press for the Bibliographical
            Society: 1916-20: 1.440-1.
